docs.title: Information technology - City data model - Part 1: Foundation level concepts
docs.text:
The Information technology - City data model - Part 1: Foundation level concepts ontology consists of the following:

  • 5087-1
  • Activity Pattern
  • Agent Pattern
  • Agreement Pattern
  • Change Pattern
  • City Units Pattern
  • Core
  • Generic Properties Pattern
  • Mereology Pattern
  • Organization Structure Pattern
  • Recurring Event Pattern
  • Resource Pattern
  • Spatial Loc Pattern

This ontology specifies the foundation-level concepts of the city data model.

This pattern imports the following patterns:

  • Agreement Pattern
  • Organization Structure Pattern
  • Recurring Event Pattern
  • prov

This pattern does not contain any classes.

The formal definition of this pattern is available in OWL Syntax.

docs.title: Formalization for Acceleration
docs.text: Property Constraint i72:value all ComplexExpr subClassOf i72:Quantity subClassOf CityUnitsThing

docs.title: Formalization for AccelerationUnit
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf i72:Unit_of_measure subClassOf CityUnitsThing

docs.title: Formalization for Activity
docs.text: Property Constraint associatedLocation all Location beginOf some time:Instant causesState all State endOf some time:Instant hasEffect all State hasStatus exactly 1 owl:Thing hasSubactivity all Activity inverse enablesActivity all State inverse preconditionOf all State occursAt some time:Interval occursBefore all Activity occursDirectlyBefore all Activity scheduledFor exactly 1 owl:Thing subClassOf ActivityThing subClassOf prov:Activity

docs.title: Used by classes
docs.text: Class Property Activity hasSubactivity Activity occursBefore Activity occursDirectlyBefore Agent (SpatialLocPattern) performs Recurring Event hasOccurrence State preconditionOf State enablesActivity State effectOf State causedByActivity

docs.title: Activity Pattern
docs.text:
This ontology specifies the foundation-level concepts related to the activity pattern of the city data model.

This pattern imports the following patterns:

  • Change Pattern
  • Spatial Loc Pattern

This pattern consists of the following classes:

  • Activity
  • Activity Status
  • Activity Thing
  • Conjunctive State
  • Disjunctive State
  • Manifestation State
  • Non Terminal State
  • State
  • State Status
  • Terminal State

The formal definition of this pattern is available in OWL Syntax.

docs.title: Specializations of ActivityThing
docs.text: Class Description Activity Activity Status Conjunctive State Consume State Disjunctive State Manifestation State Non Terminal State Produce State Release State State State Status Terminal Resource State Terminal State Use State

docs.title: Formalization for Agent
docs.text: Property Constraint hasClaim all AtomicAgreement hasDuty all AtomicAgreement hasName exactly 1 owl:Thing hasNoClaim all AtomicAgreement hasPrivilege all AtomicAgreement performs all Activity resourceOf all TerminalResourceState subClassOf AgentThing subClassOf foaf:Agent subClassOf prov:Agent subClassOf AgreementThing

docs.title: Agent Pattern
docs.text:
This ontology specifies the foundation-level concepts related to the agent pattern of the city data model.

This pattern imports the following patterns:

  • Generic Properties Pattern
  • Resource Pattern

This pattern consists of the following classes:

  • Agent (AgentPattern)
  • Agent Thing

The formal definition of this pattern is available in OWL Syntax.

docs.title: Specializations of Agreement
docs.text: Class Description Conjunctive Agreement Disjunctive Agreement

docs.title: Formalization for Agreement
docs.text: Property Constraint establishedOn all time:Instant involvesAgent min 2 owl:Thing subClassOf AgreementThing validFor all time:Interval validIn all Location

docs.title: Agreement Pattern
docs.text:
This ontology specifies the foundation-level concepts related to the agreement pattern of the city data model.

This pattern imports the following patterns:

  • Agent Pattern

This pattern consists of the following classes:

  • Agent (AgreementPattern)
  • Agreement
  • Agreement Thing
  • Atomic Agreement
  • Complex Agreement
  • Conjunctive Agreement
  • Disjunctive Agreement

The formal definition of this pattern is available in OWL Syntax.

docs.title: Specializations of AgreementThing
docs.text: Class Description Agent (SpatialLocPattern) Agreement Conjunctive Agreement Disjunctive Agreement Organization

docs.title: Formalization for AmountOfMoney
docs.text: Property Constraint i72:value all ComplexExpr subClassOf i72:Quantity subClassOf CityUnitsThing

docs.title: Formalization for Area
docs.text: Property Constraint i72:value all ComplexExpr subClassOf CityUnitsThing subClassOf i72:Quantity

docs.title: Formalization for AreaUnit
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf CityUnitsThing subClassOf i72:Unit_of_measure

docs.title: Formalization for AtomicAgreement
docs.text: Property Constraint commitsToActivity some Activity disjointWith ComplexAgreement inverse hasClaim all Agent inverse hasDuty all Agent inverse hasNoClaim all Agent inverse hasPrivilege all Agent subClassOf Agreement

docs.title: Used by classes
docs.text: Class Property Agent (SpatialLocPattern) hasClaim Agent (SpatialLocPattern) hasDuty Agent (SpatialLocPattern) hasNoClaim Agent (SpatialLocPattern) hasPrivilege

docs.title: Formalization for Capacity
docs.text: Property Constraint i72:defined_by min 1 owl:Thing subClassOf CityUnitsThing

docs.title: Formalization for CapacitySize
docs.text: Property Constraint i72:cardinality_of exactly 1 owl:Thing i72:value all ComplexExpr subClassOf CityUnitsThing subClassOf i72:Quantity

docs.title: Formalization for CardinalityMeasure
docs.text: Property Constraint i72:unit_of_measure all i72:Cardinality_unit subClassOf CityUnitsThing subClassOf i72:Measure

docs.title: Formalization for CardinalityUnitPerTime
docs.text: Property Constraint i72:denominator all TimeUnit i72:numerator all i72:Cardinality_unit subClassOf CityUnitsThing subClassOf i72:Unit_division

docs.title: Specializations of CdmThing
docs.text: Class Description Activity Activity Status Activity Thing Agent (SpatialLocPattern) Agent (SpatialLocPattern) Agent Thing Agreement Agreement Thing Capacity Capacity Size Cardinality Measure Cardinality Unit Per Time Change Thing City Units Thing Conjunctive Agreement Conjunctive State Consume State Daily Recurring Event Disjunctive Agreement Disjunctive State Divisible Resource Exception Day First Manifestation Foundational Cdm Thing Location Manifestation Manifestation State Monthly Recurring Event Non Divisible Resource Non Terminal State Organization Organization Organization Thing Planned Allocation Planned Allocation Produce State Recurring Event Recurring Event Thing Release State Resource Resource Thing Spatial Loc Thing State State Status Terminal Resource State Terminal Resource State Terminal State Use State Value Of Money Weekly Recurring Event Yearly Recurring Event

docs.title: Change Pattern
docs.text:
This ontology specifies the foundation-level concepts related to the change pattern of the city data model.

This pattern imports the following patterns:

  • Core

This pattern consists of the following classes:

  • Change Thing
  • First Manifestation
  • Manifestation

The formal definition of this pattern is available in OWL Syntax.

docs.title: Specializations of ChangeThing
docs.text: Class Description First Manifestation Manifestation Planned Allocation

docs.title: City Units Pattern
docs.text:
This ontology specifies the foundation-level concepts related to the city units pattern of the city data model.

This pattern imports the following patterns:

  • Core
  • v1

This pattern consists of the following classes:

  • Acceleration
  • Acceleration Unit
  • Amount Of Money
  • Area
  • Area Unit
  • Capacity
  • Capacity Size
  • Cardinality Measure
  • Cardinality Unit Per Time
  • City Units Thing
  • Duration
  • Geo_Position_unit
  • Length
  • Length Unit
  • Mass
  • Mass Unit
  • Monetary Value
  • Ratio
  • Speed
  • Speed Unit
  • Time Unit
  • Value Of Money
  • Volume
  • Volume Unit

The formal definition of this pattern is available in OWL Syntax.

docs.title: Specializations of CityUnitsThing
docs.text: Class Description Capacity Capacity Size Cardinality Measure Cardinality Unit Per Time Value Of Money

docs.title: Specializations of ComplexAgreement
docs.text: Class Description Conjunctive Agreement Disjunctive Agreement

docs.title: Formalization for ComplexAgreement
docs.text: Property Constraint hasSubAgreement min 2 owl:Thing subClassOf Agreement

docs.title: Formalization for ConjunctiveAgreement
docs.text: Property Constraint disjointWith DisjunctiveAgreement subClassOf ComplexAgreement

docs.title: Formalization for ConjunctiveState
docs.text: Property Constraint disjointWith DisjunctiveState subClassOf NonTerminalState

docs.title: Core
docs.text:
This ontology specifies the foundation-level concepts that are used by all other patterns of the city data model.

This pattern imports the following patterns:

  • time

This pattern consists of the following classes:

  • Cdm Thing
  • Foundational Cdm Thing

The formal definition of this pattern is available in OWL Syntax.

docs.title: Formalization for DailyRecurringEvent
docs.text: Property Constraint startTime max 1 owl:Thing subClassOf RecurringEvent

docs.title: Formalization for Duration
docs.text: Property Constraint i72:value all ComplexExpr subClassOf CityUnitsThing subClassOf i72:Quantity subClassOf time:TemporalDuration

docs.title: Formalization for ExceptionDay
docs.text: Property Constraint hasName some xsd:string onDateTimeDescription some time:GeneralDateTimeDescription subClassOf RecurringEventThing

docs.title: Formalization for FirstManifestation
docs.text: Property Constraint hasLatestManifestation exactly 1 owl:Thing precedesManifestation all Manifestation and not FirstManifestation subClassOf Manifestation

docs.title: Specializations of FoundationalCdmThing
docs.text: Class Description Activity Activity Status Activity Thing Agent (SpatialLocPattern) Agent (SpatialLocPattern) Agent Thing Agreement Agreement Thing Capacity Capacity Size Cardinality Measure Cardinality Unit Per Time Change Thing City Units Thing Conjunctive Agreement Conjunctive State Consume State Daily Recurring Event Disjunctive Agreement Disjunctive State Divisible Resource Exception Day First Manifestation Location Manifestation Manifestation State Monthly Recurring Event Non Divisible Resource Non Terminal State Organization Organization Organization Thing Planned Allocation Planned Allocation Produce State Recurring Event Recurring Event Thing Release State Resource Resource Thing Spatial Loc Thing State State Status Terminal Resource State Terminal Resource State Terminal State Use State Value Of Money Weekly Recurring Event Yearly Recurring Event

docs.title: Generic Properties Pattern
docs.text:
This ontology specifies the foundation-level concepts related to the generic properties pattern of the city data model.

This pattern imports the following patterns:

  • Core

This pattern does not contain any classes.

The formal definition of this pattern is available in OWL Syntax.

docs.title: Formalization for Length
docs.text: Property Constraint i72:value all ComplexExpr and i72:Measure subClassOf i72:Quantity

docs.title: Formalization for Location
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf geo:Geometry subClassOf SpatialLocThing

docs.title: Used by classes
docs.text: Class Property Activity associatedLocation Agreement validIn Recurring Event associatedLocation Resource hasLocation

docs.title: Specializations of Manifestation
docs.text: Class Description First Manifestation Planned Allocation

docs.title: Formalization for Manifestation
docs.text: Property Constraint existsAt exactly 1 owl:Thing hasFirstManifestation exactly 1 owl:Thing hasNextManifestation max 1 owl:Thing inverse hasNextManifestation max 1 owl:Thing subClassOf ChangeThing

docs.title: Formalization for ManifestationState
docs.text: Property Constraint satisfiedBy all Manifestation subClassOf TerminalState

docs.title: Formalization for Mass
docs.text: Property Constraint i72:value all ComplexExpr subClassOf i72:Quantity

docs.title: Mereology Pattern
docs.text:
This ontology specifies the foundation-level concepts related to the mereology pattern of the city data model.

This pattern imports the following patterns:

  • Core

This pattern does not contain any classes.

The formal definition of this pattern is available in OWL Syntax.

docs.title: Formalization for MonetaryValue
docs.text: Property Constraint hasRelativeYear exactly 1 owl:Thing i72:unit_of_measure all i72:Monetary_unit subClassOf i72:Measure

docs.title: Used by classes
docs.text: Class Property Value Of Money i72:value

docs.title: Formalization for MonthlyRecurringEvent
docs.text: Property Constraint onDateTimeDescription exactly 1 owl:Thing subClassOf RecurringEvent

docs.title: Specializations of NonTerminalState
docs.text: Class Description Conjunctive State Disjunctive State

docs.title: Formalization for NonTerminalState
docs.text: Property Constraint disjointWith TerminalState hasDecomp min 2 owl:Thing hasSubstate all State subClassOf State

docs.title: Formalization for Organization
docs.text: Property Constraint subClassOf Agent subClassOf OrganizationThing subClassOf org:Organization

docs.title: Organization Structure Pattern
docs.text:
This ontology specifies the foundation-level concepts related to the organization structure pattern of the city data model.

This pattern imports the following patterns:

  • Agent Pattern
  • org

This pattern consists of the following classes:

  • Organization
  • Organization Thing

The formal definition of this pattern is available in OWL Syntax.

docs.title: Formalization for PlannedAllocation
docs.text: Property Constraint forResource exactly 1 owl:Thing hasQuantity exactly 1 owl:Thing inverse hasAllocation exactly 1 owl:Thing subClassOf Manifestation subClassOf ResourceThing time:hasTime exactly 1 owl:Thing

docs.title: Used by classes
docs.text: Class Property Resource hasAllocation Terminal Resource State hasAllocation

docs.title: Specializations of RecurringEvent
docs.text: Class Description Daily Recurring Event Monthly Recurring Event Weekly Recurring Event Yearly Recurring Event

docs.title: Formalization for RecurringEvent
docs.text: Property Constraint associatedLocation all Location beginsRecurringState all State beginsRecurringTime all time:TemporalEntity endsRecurringState all State endsRecurringTime all time:TemporalEntity endTime all xsd:time hasDayOfWeek all time:DayOfWeek hasOccurrence all Activity hasSubRecurringEvent all RecurringEvent onDateTimeDescription all time:GeneralDateTimeDescription recursAddition all time:DayOfWeek or time:TemporalEntity recursExcept all time:DayOfWeek or time:TemporalEntity startTime all xsd:time subClassOf RecurringEventThing

docs.title: Recurring Event Pattern
docs.text:
This ontology specifies the foundation-level concepts related to the recurring event pattern of the city data model.

This pattern imports the following patterns:

  • Activity Pattern
  • Generic Properties Pattern

This pattern consists of the following classes:

  • Daily Recurring Event
  • Exception Day
  • Monthly Recurring Event
  • Recurring Event
  • Recurring Event Thing
  • Weekly Recurring Event
  • Yearly Recurring Event

The formal definition of this pattern is available in OWL Syntax.

docs.title: Specializations of RecurringEventThing
docs.text: Class Description Daily Recurring Event Exception Day Monthly Recurring Event Recurring Event Weekly Recurring Event Yearly Recurring Event

docs.title: Specializations of Resource
docs.text: Class Description Divisible Resource Non Divisible Resource

docs.title: Formalization for Resource
docs.text: Property Constraint capacityInUse exactly 1 owl:Thing hasAllocation all PlannedAllocation hasAvailableCapacity exactly 1 owl:Thing hasCapacity exactly 1 owl:Thing hasLocation all Location participatesIn min 1 owl:Thing subClassOf ResourceThing

docs.title: Used by classes
docs.text: Class Property Terminal Resource State hasResource

docs.title: Resource Pattern
docs.text:
This ontology specifies the foundation-level concepts related to the resource pattern of the city data model.

This pattern imports the following patterns:

  • Activity Pattern
  • City Units Pattern

This pattern consists of the following classes:

  • Consume State
  • Divisible Resource
  • Non Divisible Resource
  • Planned Allocation
  • Produce State
  • Release State
  • Resource
  • Resource Thing
  • Terminal Resource State
  • Use State

The formal definition of this pattern is available in OWL Syntax.

docs.title: Specializations of ResourceThing
docs.text: Class Description Consume State Divisible Resource Non Divisible Resource Planned Allocation Produce State Release State Resource Terminal Resource State Use State

docs.title: Spatial Loc Pattern
docs.text:
This ontology specifies the foundation-level concepts related to the spatial location pattern of the city data model.

This pattern imports the following patterns:

  • Mereology Pattern
  • geosparql

This pattern consists of the following classes:

  • Location
  • Spatial Loc Thing

The formal definition of this pattern is available in OWL Syntax.

docs.title: Formalization for Speed
docs.text: Property Constraint i72:value all ComplexExpr subClassOf i72:Quantity

docs.title: Specializations of State
docs.text: Class Description Conjunctive State Consume State Disjunctive State Manifestation State Non Terminal State Produce State Release State Terminal Resource State Terminal State Use State

docs.title: Formalization for State
docs.text: Property Constraint achievedAt all time:TemporalEntity enablesActivity all Activity hasStatus exactly 1 owl:Thing inverse causesState all Activity inverse hasEffect all Activity preconditionOf all Activity scheduledFor max 1 owl:Thing subClassOf ActivityThing

docs.title: Used by classes
docs.text: Class Property Activity hasPrecondition Activity enabledByState Activity hasEffect Activity causesState Non Terminal State hasSubstate Recurring Event beginsRecurringState Recurring Event endsRecurringState

docs.title: Specializations of TerminalResourceState
docs.text: Class Description Consume State Produce State Release State Use State

docs.title: Formalization for TerminalResourceState
docs.text: Property Constraint hasAllocation all PlannedAllocation hasQuantity all i72:Quantity inverse resourceOf all Resource subClassOf TerminalState subClassOf ResourceThing

docs.title: Specializations of TerminalState
docs.text: Class Description Consume State Manifestation State Produce State Release State Terminal Resource State Use State

docs.title: Used by classes
docs.text: Class Property Cardinality Unit Per Time i72:denominator

docs.title: Formalization for ValueOfMoney
docs.text: Property Constraint i72:value all MonetaryValue subClassOf AmountOfMoney

docs.title: Formalization for Volume
docs.text: Property Constraint i72:value all ComplexExpr subClassOf i72:Quantity

docs.title: Formalization for WeeklyRecurringEvent
docs.text: Property Constraint hasDayOfWeek exactly 1 owl:Thing subClassOf RecurringEvent

docs.title: Formalization for YearlyRecurringEvent
docs.text: Property Constraint onDateTimeDescription exactly 1 owl:Thing subClassOf RecurringEvent
